subject: Technology
title: Blackouts: When the Grid Fails
description: One-minute skill: Blackouts: When the Grid Fails.

hook.text: In 2021, a winter storm knocked out Texas's power grid. Millions froze in their homes for days.

buildup.text: Texas operates its own grid, isolated from the rest of the country. When it failed, nobody could send help.

discovery.text: The grid wasn't winterized. Frozen natural gas pipelines and iced turbines cut power when demand was highest.

twist.text: Texas had been warned this exact scenario was possible after a smaller freeze in 2011. Recommendations were ignored.

climax.text: The blackout killed over 200 people and caused $195 billion in damage. Infrastructure neglect has deadly consequences.

punchline.text: The Texas grid failed because saving money was prioritized over saving lives.

quiz.question: Why couldn't other states help Texas during the 2021 blackout?
options: Texas operates its own isolated power grid
Federal law prohibited interstate power transfers
